scenario:
Marvell Technology (MRVL) has seen significant growth in its AI chip business, up 83% last year, driven by its burgeoning artificial intelligence chip business. Its AI chip portfolio is booming, causing enthusiastic investors to bid Marvell up to a high valuation. Marvell has a smaller but similar portfolio to Broadcom's (AVGO) semiconductor business, which includes ASICs, networking chips, and digital signal processors for AI data centers.

Marvell has a comprehensive, multi-generation five-year collaboration agreement with Amazon (AMZN), its largest cloud computing platform customer, which bodes well for the company. Marvell's innovation engine has also unveiled a new custom high-bandwidth memory (HBM) interface technology that will enable custom ASICs to process memory faster and with lower power.

The data center segment grew a whopping 98% last quarter, and now makes up 72.6% of revenue. However, Marvell trades at 43 times next year's earnings estimates, which is a high multiple. The company's addressable market is expected to rise from $21 billion to $75 billion by 2028, with management seeing its market share growing from 10% to 20% by that time.

Assuming Marvell hits its target, it would make $19 billion in total revenue in 2028, with $5.7 billion in operating earnings and just under $5 billion in net income. Marvell's market cap is over $100 billion, so investors are essentially paying over 20 times 2028 earnings. However, if the AI market continues to blossom, the stock appears a hold today.
